name: Islamic Mythology
tagline: The Final Revelation and Prophetic Tradition
description: Explore Islamic sacred narratives of prophets, angels, jinn, and the oneness of Allah.
overview: Islamic mythology centers on strict monotheism (Tawhid) - Allah as the one, indivisible God who revealed His will through prophets culminating in Muhammad (peace be upon him) and the Quran. The tradition includes: angelic hierarchies (Jibreel/Gabriel, Mikail/Michael), jinn (beings of smokeless fire with free will), prophetic narratives shared with Judaism and Christianity (Adam, Ibrahim, Musa, Isa), the Night Journey (Isra and Mi'raj) where Muhammad ascended through the seven heavens, Judgment Day, Paradise (Jannah), and Hell (Jahannam). Islamic cosmology emphasizes submission (islam) to Allah's will, following the Straight Path, and the ummah (community of believers).

sections.title: Tawhid: Divine Oneness
sections.body: **Allah:** The one, eternal, all-powerful, all-merciful God. No partners, no equals, beyond human comprehension yet closer than the jugular vein. 99 Beautiful Names describing divine attributes (Ar-Rahman - The Most Merciful, Al-Hakim - The All-Wise, etc.). The core Islamic testimony (Shahada): 'There is no god but Allah, and Muhammad is His messenger.'
